com.linkedin.parseq

Class BaseTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linkedin.parseq.promise.DelegatingPromise<T>
      • com.linkedin.parseq.BaseTask<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable, Promise<T>, Task<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionTask, AsyncCallableTask, CallableTask, FusionTask, Par2Task, Par3Task, Par4Task, Par5Task, Par6Task, Par7Task, Par8Task, Par9Task

    public abstract class BaseTask<T>
extends DelegatingPromise<T>
implements Task<T>
    An abstract base class that can be used to build implementations of Task.
    Author:
    Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com), Chi Chan (ckchan@linkedin.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseTask

        public BaseTask()
        Constructs a base task without a specified name. The name for this task will be the toString() representation for this instance. It is usually best to use BaseTask(String).

      • BaseTask

        public BaseTask(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a base task with a name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for this task.

      • setPriority

        public boolean setPriority(int priority)
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Overrides the priority for this task. Higher priority tasks will be executed before lower priority tasks in the same context. In most cases, the default priority is sufficient.

        The default priority is 0. Use priority < 0 to make a task lower priority and priority > 0 to make a task higher priority.

        If the task has already started execution the priority cannot be changed.

        Specified by:
        setPriority in interface Task<T>
        Parameters:
        priority - the new priority for the task.
        Returns:
        true if the priority was set; otherwise false.
        See Also:
        Priority

      • contextRun

        public final void contextRun(Context context,
                             Task<?> parent,
                             java.util.Collection<Task<?>> predecessors)
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Attempts to run the task with the given context. This method is reserved for use by Engine and Context.
        Specified by:
        contextRun in interface Task<T>
        Parameters:
        context - the context to use while running this step
        parent - the parent of this task
        predecessors - that lead to the execution of this task

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this task. If no name was set during construction this method will return the value of toString(). In most cases it is preferable to explicitly set a name.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Task<T>
        Returns:
        the name of this task

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel(java.lang.Exception rootReason)
        Description copied from interface: Cancellable
        Attempts to cancel the object with the given reason. Check the return value to determine if cancellation was successful. Subsequent calls to cancel will always return false.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Cancellable
        Parameters:
        rootReason - an Exception indicating why this object was cancelled
        Returns:
        true iff the object was successfully cancelled as a result of this invocation.

      • getShallowTrace

        public ShallowTrace getShallowTrace()
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Returns the ShallowTrace for this task. The ShallowTrace will be a point-in-time snapshot and may change over time until the task is completed.
        Specified by:
        getShallowTrace in interface Task<T>
        Returns:
        the ShallowTrace related to this task

      • setTraceValueSerializer

        public void setTraceValueSerializer(java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.String> traceValueProvider)
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Allows adding String representation of value computed by this task to trace. When this task is finished successfully, value will be converted to String using given serializer and it will be included in this task's trace.

        Failures are automatically included in a trace.

        Specified by:
        setTraceValueSerializer in interface Task<T>
        Parameters:
        traceValueProvider - serialized used for converting result of this task to String that will be included in this task's trace.

      • getTrace

        public Trace getTrace()
        Description copied from interface: Task
        Returns the Trace for this task. The Trace will be a point-in-time snapshot and may change over time until the task is completed.
        Specified by:
        getTrace in interface Task<T>
        Returns:
        the Trace related to this task

      • run

        protected abstract Promise<? extends T> run(Context context)
                                     throws java.lang.Throwable
        This template method is invoked when the task is run.
        Parameters:
        context - the context to use while running this task
        Returns:
        a promise that will have its value set when this task is finished
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs while running the task
